content: Simeon, the one thing I would add there as you look at the sequential trend of those retail volumes during the quarter, right, and seeing the slight improvement quarter -- month over month during the quarter, to John's point, gives us some optimism, but we're staying on soft ground here, knowing that there's a lot of uncertainty with the macro backdrop. And then as you look at Q4, it does tend to be a higher beta quarter for us, and it tends to be -- there's just with the weather and the number of retail customers that come through, you tend to see a little bit more volatility in Q4, relatively more volatility during Q4.
